alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 7:48AM MDT until May 11 at 10:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM MDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL EL PASO COUNTY... At 748 AM MDT, the public reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. A retention pond near Eagleside Elementary school was reported to be overflowing HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southeastern Colorado Springs, Fountain and Security-Widefield. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
